intro: Fritillaria raddeana, commonly known as the Persian fritillary, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically orange or reddish in color, with intricate patterns. The plant belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
